title: Derek Chisora stages press-up competition at open workout with adorable puppy stealing show
text:
Chisora was accompanied by his bulldog puppy (Picture: Reuters)

Derek Chisora axed his public workout on Wednesday night to stage a press-up competition and hand out VIP tickets to fans.

The British heavyweight takes on David Price on Saturday night as the chief support to Josh Taylor’s unification showdown against Regis Prograis.

Chisora has already expressed his annoyance at being co-main for a London fight night and hit out at promoter Eddie Hearn again when he finally arrived at the Old Spitalfields Market workouts.

‘The fans love heavyweights who knock each other out,’ Chisora told the crowd who had waited around for his appearance. ‘Not little guys doing their dance.’

Winston was the star of the show (Picture: Reuters)

Chisora also staged a press-up competition to determine which fan would be the lucky punter to take home VIP tickets for Saturday night.

Accompanied by his adorable bulldog puppy, Winston, Chisora invited two fans into the ring who went head-to-head for the tickets.

The winner, who managed 54 press-ups, took home the tickets while the loser got a pair of signed golden gloves.

I really appreciate the fans for embracing me and loving me. Saturday night I’ll deliver at @TheO2 🙏🏾 #warchisora pic.twitter.com/48QVoL1BGK — Derek Chisora 🥊 (@DerekWarChisora) October 24, 2019

While Winston stole the show, there was another surprise earlier in the day as Chisora confirmed his new trainer.

After splitting from Dave Coldwell, Chisora claimed he would be training and cornering himself for the Price fight.

But Chisora has now announced Steve Broughton as his new coach, saying: ‘You know me, I like to surprise people.

One fan got VIP tickets to fight night (Picture: Reuters)

‘I’ve been working with Steve for a while now but it was on a need to know basis.

‘The surprises will continue and on Saturday night David Price won’t know what’s about to be unleashed on him.’

Chisora did get some workout done on Wednesday night, going up against Prograis in their own press-up competition.

Del Boy’s attempt at a one-handed press-up failed and Prograis managed to out last the heavyweight.

description: Derek Chisora brought his bulldog puppy to an open workout ahead of his boxing fight, but axed the session and stage a press-up competition.
